title: Controversial Budget Bill Would Roll Back Dodd-Frank Provision
teaser: The House is expected to vote Thursday on a spending bill designed to avert another government shutdown. Among the controversies: a rollback of the Dodd-Frank financial market regulatory overhaul. Banks have lobbied to get rid of a provision requiring them to "push out" derivatives trading.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
